intro: Adriana gaudichaudii var. thomasiifolia, commonly known as the Thomasiifolia variety of Adriana gaudichaudii, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in coastal areas with a warm, temperate climate. Its foliage is evergreen, with glossy, lance-shaped leaves that provide a striking contrast to its delicate blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
